_header: A man that will of wisdom lere / Harken to the book of prophecies here
Note: For MSS without the Prologue see 5125; for others with a 16-line Prologue see 6829.
_description: Prognostics for the year, according to the day on which New Year falls, with a Prologue of twenty-two lines.

CULFf548.First Lines:
A man þat will of wisdam lereherkyn to þe boke of
                    professes here…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Many beestes I þe telleIn þat ȝere shall be
                    quell
CULFf548.Note:
After prologue, text begins, line 23, ‘Take we nowþat ilke
                    ȝere / þat begynnes in Janiuere…’.
CULFf548.Editions:

             “Prognostications Drawn from the Day of the Week on Which the New Year
                Commences.”

Förster,  Max. 
             “Beiträge zur mittelalterlichen Volkskunde, VI-VII.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und

         128 (1912): 55-71; 285-308: 292-3.
